nodes.bodyText:
This is an internal feature common across each of the public messaging features, right?
Does there need to be a separate private API feature (io.openliberty.jakarta.messaging.3.0) for other components to pull in just the API ... or should they use the api bundle directly?

Oddly no, not at this time.  Features that require the messaging api declare a dependency on this internal feature.  I can certainly add the API feature and modify the internal feature dependency.  Although the new API feature would be nearly vestigial, maintaining this feature pattern will facilitate serviceability and devOps.
That would be fine if this feature only pulled in APIs needed for Messaging... but it also pulls in connectors internals and transactions.
No problem!  I meant "maintaining the api-specific feature pattern ...".  The change is uploaded.  Note that a feature specific to the javaee/javax jms api does not exist in previous releases.

change
This feature enables the configuration of resource adapters to access messaging systems using 
the Jakarta Message Service API.
to
This feature enables the configuration of resource adapters to access messaging systems by using 
the Jakarta Message Service API.

nodes.bodyText:
messagingClient-3.0 should not be able to co-exist with wasJmsClient-2.0
Is it enough to mark this as a singleton, or is there something else required (like supersedes) to ensure that these two features should clash?
A similar consideration is required for all the renamed features.

The dependency on private feature com.ibm.websphere.appserver.eeCompatible-9.0 will ensure that messagingClient cannot be configured with any javaEE[6..8]-compatible feature.  Same for the other messaging features.  At server startup when the feature resolver detects such a configuration it will create a singleton conflict.  The feature manager will then log the conflict as an error specific to javaee+jakartaee feature incompatibility and remove the conflicting features from list of features to provision.
As mentioned elsewhere, please can we make this 3.0 instead of 2.0?
Yes we can.
As mentioned elsewhere, please can we make this 3.0 instead of 2.0?
Yes, we've the green light on bumping all jakarta messaging features to version 3.0.
I note that elsewhere in this set of changes, a file has been changed solely to add a trailing newline. By that token, does this also need one?
We can ignore the newline.  Other file(s) indicate a newline difference because I either added or removed a newline while resolving merge conflicts.

add serial comma per IBM style:
This feature also enables the configuration of Jakarta Message Service connection 
factories, queues, topics, and activation specifications.
